Package boardModel

Class LogicBoard

java.lang.Object
boardModel.LogicBoard
public class LogicBoard extends Object
Version:
2, July 2022

The underlying model of a logic board.

Gates can be placed on the board by storing a mapping which maps positions on the board to a Gate object.

Connections between Gates are stored implicitly in the Gates.

If necessary, the model tells the GUI to update the visualization and gives the GUI the required information to do that, but the GUI cannot change anything in the model.

Author:
Dominik Baumann

      TODO this is not at all doing anything, or serving a reasonable purpose

    • inEvaluatedState

      boolean inEvaluatedState
      Keep track of whether the board has been evaluated => set it to true

      Set to false after executing some command (e.g. placing a gate) on an evaluated board.

  • Constructor Details

    • LogicBoard

      public LogicBoard(LogicBoardGUI gui_)
      The constructor needs to know which GUI to address.
      Parameters:
      gui_ - The GUI that is visualizing this board.

  • Method Details

    • addGate

      public void addGate(Gate g, Vector2Int v)
      Add a gate at a given position. If another gate was previously present at this position, maintain existing connections. If the new gate is a NOT-gate, only one input will be maintained (with TOP being prioritized over BOTTOM).
      Parameters:
      g - Gate to add to the board.
      v - Position at which to add the gate.

    • removeGate

      public ArrayList<GateWithIndexTuple> removeGate(Vector2Int v)
      Remove a gate at a given position.
      Parameters:
      v - The position at which to remove a gate.
      Returns:
      A list with gates that received input from the removed gate. This information is required for undoing the removal of the gate.
      See Also:
      • RemoveGateAt

    • addConnection

      public void addConnection(Vector2Int fromOutput, Vector2Int toInput, GateIndex inputIndex)
      Adds a connection between two gates (which are specified by their position on the board).
      Parameters:
      fromOutput - The Gate which provides its output value as input.
      toInput - The Gate which receives input from another Gate.
      inputIndex - Decides which of the input slots to connect to.

    • removeConnection

      public void removeConnection(Vector2Int pos, GateIndex ind)
      Remove the connection going to this gate at the specified input.

      This function is used primarily for UNDOING the creation of connections, which is why it doesn't need to perform any checks with clickedNearConnection.

      Parameters:
      pos - The position of the gate to which the connection leads that is to be deleted.
      ind - The input identifier for the connection on this gate.

    • attemptConnectionRemoval

      public boolean attemptConnectionRemoval(Vector3Int clickPos, TryToRemoveConnection command)
      Given a position (of a right mouse click), check if this position is close to any connection on the board. If so, remove that connection.

      If there are multiple connections nearby, only one gets removed.

      Parameters:
      clickPos - Position of (right) mouse click.
      command - The command for attempting to remove the connection.
      Returns:
      True iff the click was near an existing connection

    • updateGUI

      private void updateGUI()
      COMMUNICATION WITH GUI

    • evaluate

      public void evaluate()
      Call the function for computing a gate's output on all gates which do not serve as input to another gate (i.e. when their outputCount is 0).

    • updateGateInputs

      private ArrayList<GateWithIndexTuple> updateGateInputs(Gate from, Gate to)
      Checks all gates on the board if they have "from" as an input, and if so, replace that input with "to".
      Parameters:
      from - A gate which is (potentially) used as input.
      to - A gate which should replace all ocurrences of "from" as input.
      Returns:
      A list with gates that received input from the removed gate. This information is required for undoing the removal of the gate.
      See Also:
      • RemoveGateAt

    • setOutputCount

      private void setOutputCount(Gate g, int count)
      Given a gate, keep track of how often its output is used as input on other gates. Note that one gate may provide its output for both inputs of another gate.
      Parameters:
      g - A gate which has the count of inputs it provides for increased or reduced.
      count - The number of gates this gate is serving as input for.

    • getOutputCount

      private int getOutputCount(Gate g)
      Find out for how many inputs this gate's output is used.
      Parameters:
      g - A gate on the board.
      Returns:
      The number of inputs for which this gate's output is used.

    • formsCycle

      public boolean formsCycle(Vector2Int start, Vector2Int end, GateIndex startIndex, GateIndex endIndex)
      Given two gates (specified by their position on the grid), add a new connection to the model and check if the model then contains a cycle.

      After the test, remove that connection again.

      Parameters:
      start - Start coordinates of connection
      end - end coordinates of connection
      startIndex - Identifier for the input / output used at the start of the connection.
      endIndex - Identifier for the input / output used at the end of the connection.
      Returns:
      "true" iff the new connection forms a cycle

    • simulateNewConnection

      private boolean simulateNewConnection(Vector2Int start, Vector2Int end, GateIndex startIndex, GateIndex endIndex)
      Add a new connection to the model, check if the model then contains a cycle, then remove the connection again
      Parameters:
      start - Start coordinates of connection
      end - end coordinates of connection
      startIndex - Identifier for the input / output used at the start of the connection.
      endIndex - Identifier for the input / output used at the end of the connection.
      Returns:
      "true" iff the new connection forms a cycle

    • hasCycle

      private boolean hasCycle(Vector2Int start)
      This function tests if the connections in the current model form a cycle - essentially by performing a depth first search.

      IDEA: Pick a gate to start with, and get the gates that are providing an input for it. For each gate providing an input, check their input ... and so on

      If the starting gate is reached again, we know that the connections on the board form a cycle.

      Parameters:
      start - Grid position of a tile
      Returns:
      "true" iff the connections in the model form a cycle

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Remove all gates from the board and tell the GUI to update accordingly.

    • resetStatusOfGatesOnBoard

      private void resetStatusOfGatesOnBoard()
      Reset the status of all gates on the board to UNEVALUATED if they are in a different state.

      This has purely cosmetic effects on the visualization.

    • numberOfGates

      public int numberOfGates()
      Returns:
      The number of gates in the model
      See Also:
      • BoardSaver

    • setGates

      public void setGates(TreeMap<Vector2Int,Gate> gates_, HashMap<Gate,Integer> outputGates_)
      Used for bringing back a board via "Undo" after issuing the command ResetBoard.
      Parameters:
      gates_ - A record of all gates on the board.
      outputGates_ - A record of all gates that are not providing input to another gate.

    • getGates

      public TreeMap<Vector2Int,Gate> getGates()
      Returns:
      A copy of the record of gates on the board.
      See Also:
      • ResetBoard

    • getOutputGates

      public HashMap<Gate,Integer> getOutputGates()
      Returns:
      A copy of the record of gates providing no input to other gates.
      See Also:
      • ResetBoard

    • hasGate

      public boolean hasGate(Vector2Int v)
      Allow the controller to check if the model has a gate at a certain position
      Parameters:
      v - A position to check for gates.
      Returns:
      "true" iff the model has a gate at this position.

    • getGate

      public Gate getGate(Vector2Int v)
      Get a gate on the board by its position.
      Parameters:
      v - The (potential) position of a gate on the board
      Returns:
      The gate at that position, OR null if no gate is there

    • getGateType

      public TileType getGateType(Vector2Int v)
      Parameters:
      v - The (potential) position of a gate on the board.
      Returns:
      The type of gate at that position as TileType.

    • getPositionOfGate

      public Vector2Int getPositionOfGate(Gate g)
      This function finds the position of a gate on the board.
      Parameters:
      g - A gate on the board
      Returns:
      the grid position of the given gate on the board (OR null if the gate was not on the board)

    • clickedNearConnection

      private boolean clickedNearConnection(Vector3Int clickPos, Gate gate, Vector2Int gatePos, GateIndex ind)
      Check if a position (of a right mouse click) lies close to a connection on the board.
      Parameters:
      clickPos - The position of a right mouse click.
      gate - A gate for which to investigate incoming connections.
      gatePos - The position of that gate.
      ind - The input identifier which is considered.
      Returns:
      True iff the click was near to an existing connection.

    • toStorageString

      public String toStorageString()
      Returns:
      A string representation of the model, fit to be saved to a .txt-file
      See Also:
      • BoardSaver
